Sentence_1: This rescript on morality has been caused to be written by king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin.
Sentence_2: Here no living being must be killed and sacrificed.
Sentence_3: And no festival meeting must be held.
Sentence_4: For king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin sees much evil in festival meetings.
Sentence_5: But there are also some festival meetings which are considered meritorious by king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin.
Sentence_6: Formerly in the kitchen of king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin many hundred thousands of animals were killed daily for the sake of curry.
Sentence_7: But now; when this rescript on morality is written; only three animals are being killed (daily) for the sake of curry; (viz.) two peacocks (and) one deer; (but) even this deer not regularly.
Sentence_8: Even these three animals shall not be killed in future.

Sentence_1: Everywhere in the dominions of king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin; and likewise among (his) borderers; such as the Choḍas; the Pāṇḍyas; the Satiyaputa; the Ketalaputa; even Tāmraparṇī; the Yona king Antiyaka; and also the kings who are the neighbours of this Antiyaka; – everywhere two (kinds of) medical treatment were established by king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin; (viz.) medical treatment for men and medical treatment for cattle.
Sentence_2: And wherever there were no herbs that are beneficial to men and beneficial to cattle; everywhere they were caused to be imported and to be planted.
Sentence_3: Wherever there were no roots and fruits; everywhere they were caused to be imported and to be planted.
Sentence_4: On the roads wells were caused to be dug; and trees were caused to be planted for the use of cattle and men.

Sentence_1: King Devānāṃpriya Priyadarśin speaks thus.
Sentence_2: (When I had been) anointed twelve years; the following was ordered by me.
Sentence_3: Everywhere in my dominions the Yuktas; the Rājūka; and the Prādeśika shall set out on a complete tour (throughout their charges) every five years for this very purpose; (viz.) for the following instruction in morality as well as for other business.
Sentence_4: ‘Meritorious is obedience to mother and father. Liberality to friends; acquaintances; and relatives; to Brāhmaṇas and Śramaṇas is meritorious. Abstention from killing animals is meritorious. Moderation in expenditure (and) moderation in possessions are meritorious.’
Sentence_5: The council (of Mahāmātras) also shall order the Yuktas to register (these rules) both with (the addition of) reasons and according to the letter.

Sentence_1: In times past; for many hundreds of years; there had ever been promoted the killing of animals and the hurting of living beings; discourtesy to relatives; (and) discourtesy to Brāhmaṇas and Śramaṇas.
Sentence_2: But now; in consequence of the practice of morality on the part of king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin; the sound of drums has become the sound of morality; showing the people representations of aerial chariots; representations of elephants; masses of fire; and other divine figures.
Sentence_3: Such as they had not existed before for many hundreds of years; thus there are now promoted; through the instruction in morality on the part of king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarsin; abstention from killing animals; abstention from hurting living beings; courtesy to relatives; courtesy to Brāhmaṇas and Śramaṇas; obedience to mother (and) father; (and) obedience to the aged.
Sentence_4: In this and many other ways is the practice of morality promoted.
Sentence_5: And king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin will ever promote this practice of morality.
Sentence_6: And the sons; grandsons; and great-grandsons of king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin will promote this practice of morality until the æon of destruction (of the world) (and) will instruct (people) in morality; abiding by morality (and) by good conduct.
Sentence_7: For this is the best work; viz. instruction in morality.
Sentence_8: And the practice of morality is not (possible) for (a person) devoid of good conduct.
Sentence_9: Therefore promotion and not neglect of this object is meritorious.
Sentence_10: For the following purpose has this been caused to be written; (viz. in order that) they should devote themselves to the promotion of this practice; and that the neglect (of it) should not be approved (by them).
Sentence_11: This was caused to be written by king Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin (when he had been) anointed twelve years.

Sentence_1: King Devānāṁpriya Priyadarśin speaks thus.
Sentence_2: In times past neither the disposal of affairs nor the submission of reports at any time did exist before.
Sentence_3: But I have made the following (arrangement).
Sentence_4: Reporters are posted everywhere; (with instructions) to report to me the affairs of the people at any time; while I am eating; in the harem; in the inner apartment; even at the cowpen; in the palanquin; and in the parks.
Sentence_5: And everywhere I am disposing of the affairs of the people.
Sentence_6: And if in the council (of Mahāmātras) a dispute arises; or an amendment is moved; in connexion with any donation or proclamation which I myself am ordering verbally; or (in connexion with) an emergent matter which has been delegated to the Mahāmātras; it must be reported to me immediately; anywhere; (and) at any time.
Sentence_7: Thus I have ordered.
Sentence_8: For I am never content in exerting myself and in dispatching business.
Sentence_9: For I consider it my duty (to promote) the welfare of all men.
Sentence_10: But the root of that (is) this; (viz.) exertion and the dispatch of business.
Sentence_11: For no duty is more important than (promoting) the welfare of all men.
Sentence_12: And whatever effort I am making; (is made) in order that I may discharge the debt (which I owe) to living beings; (that) I may make them happy in this (world); and (that) they may attain heaven in the other (world).
Sentence_13: For the following purpose has this rescript on morality been caused to be written; (viz.) that it may last long; and that my sons; grandsons; and great-grandsons may conform to this for the welfare of all men.
Sentence_14: But it is difficult to accomplish this without great zeal.
